title: Galatians Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Galatians chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Galatians Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Galatians Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:1, in what should we stand fast?
options: The liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free
questions.correctAnswer: The liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:1 instructs believers to stand fast in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 5:2 says that circumcision will profit those who are in Christ.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:2 clearly states that if you are circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

questions.question: What does Paul say a circumcised man is a debtor to do, according to Galatians 5:3?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:3 states that a circumcised man is a debtor to do the whole law.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Christ is become ______ unto you, whosoever of you are justified by the law; ye are fallen from grace.'
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:4 says Christ is become of no effect unto those justified by the law.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:6, what works by love?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:6 teaches that faith which worketh by love is what matters in Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Who did Paul say was hindering the Galatians from obeying the truth in Galatians 5:7?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:7 asks who hindered the Galatians from obeying the truth, referring to false persuasion.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 5:9 says a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:9 uses the metaphor of leaven to describe how a small influence can affect the whole.

questions.question: What does Paul say will happen to those who trouble the Galatians in Galatians 5:10?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:10 states that those who trouble the believers shall bear their judgment.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:13, what should not be used as an occasion to the flesh?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:13 warns believers to not use liberty as an occasion to the flesh.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Galatians 5:14: 'For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt ______ thy neighbour as thyself.'
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:14 quotes the command to love thy neighbour as thyself as fulfilling the law.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:16, what will you not fulfil if you walk in the Spirit?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:16 teaches that walking in the Spirit prevents fulfilling the lust of the flesh.

questions.question: What are contrary to one another as stated in Galatians 5:17?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:17 states the flesh lusteth against the Spirit and the Spirit against the flesh.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 5:18 says that if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are under the law.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:18 says that if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a work of the flesh in Galatians 5:19-21?
questions.explanation: Meekness is listed as a fruit of the Spirit, not a work of the flesh, according to Galatians 5:22-23.

questions.question: What is described as the fruit of the Spirit in Galatians 5:22?
options: Love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith
questions.correctAnswer: Love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:22 lists these as the fruit of the Spirit.

medium.title: Galatians Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Galatians Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Galatians 5:1 teach us to respond when tempted to return to legalistic practices instead of living in freedom?
options: Stand fast in the liberty Christ has given and avoid bondage
Accept circumcision as necessary for salvation
Follow the whole law strictly to be justified
Ignore faith and focus on works
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast in the liberty Christ has given and avoid bondage
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:1 encourages believers to stand firm in the freedom Christ provides and warns against being entangled again in the yoke of bondage. This is supported by verses 5:2-4 which reject justification by the law and emphasize faith.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with the temptation to rely on outward religious rituals for acceptance. According to Galatians 5:6, what is the most important thing in Christ?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:6 teaches that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision matters, but faith expressing itself through love is what counts. This highlights the primacy of heartfelt faith over ritual (verses 5:2-4, 5:14).

questions.question: What does Galatians 5:13 warn against when using Christian liberty?
options: Using liberty as an opportunity for the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Using liberty as an opportunity for the flesh
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:13 advises believers to not misuse their freedom as a cover for selfish desires but to serve one another in love, aligning with the fulfillment of the law in loving one's neighbor (5:14).

questions.question: Based on Galatians 5:14, what is the summary of the entire law?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:14 states that the whole law is fulfilled in the command to love your neighbor as yourself, emphasizing love as the guiding principle of Christian conduct (5:13-15).

questions.question: A believer is frustrated by conflicts within their church. According to Galatians 5:15, what warning should you share?
options: If you bite and devour one another, you will be consumed by one another
Avoid all disagreements at all costs
Ignore those who disagree with you
Focus on your own spiritual growth only
questions.correctAnswer: If you bite and devour one another, you will be consumed by one another
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:15 warns that destructive behavior like biting and devouring one another leads to mutual destruction, encouraging believers to pursue peace and unity (5:13-14).

questions.question: What practical advice does Galatians 5:16 give for overcoming temptation to sinful desires?
options: Walk in the Spirit to avoid fulfilling the lust of the flesh
Rely on your own strength alone
questions.correctAnswer: Walk in the Spirit to avoid fulfilling the lust of the flesh
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:16 instructs believers to walk by the Spirit as the way to resist the desires of the flesh, supported by verses 5:17-18 which describe the conflict between flesh and Spirit.

questions.question: How does Galatians 5:17 describe the relationship between the flesh and the Spirit?
options: They are contrary to each other, making it difficult to do what you want
The Spirit always wins over the flesh without struggle
The flesh is stronger than the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: They are contrary to each other, making it difficult to do what you want
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:17 explains the flesh and Spirit are in opposition, causing internal struggle, which teaches the need for dependence on the Spirit to live righteously (5:16, 5:18).

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 5:18, if you are led by the Spirit, you are no longer under the law.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:18 states that being led by the Spirit frees believers from being under the law, emphasizing the new covenant of grace rather than legalistic observance.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a work of the flesh in Galatians 5:19-21?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:19-21 lists many works of the flesh including envyings, murders, and drunkenness, but faith is not among them; faith is a fruit of the Spirit (5:22-23).

questions.question: What fruit of the Spirit is mentioned first in Galatians 5:22?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:22 lists the fruit of the Spirit beginning with love, highlighting its foundational role in Christian character (5:13-14).

questions.question: Based on Galatians 5:24, how are believers described in their relationship to the flesh?
options: They have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
They ignore the flesh without struggle
questions.correctAnswer: They have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:24 teaches that those belonging to Christ have put to death the sinful desires of the flesh, indicating a decisive break with former sinful ways.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 5:26 encourages believers to be desirous of vain glory and provoke each other.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:26 warns against seeking empty praise and provoking or envying one another, promoting humility and harmony instead.

questions.question: How does Galatians 5:10 encourage believers when facing troublemakers in the church?
options: Have confidence that you will remain true, and that troublemakers will face judgment
Join the troublemakers to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Have confidence that you will remain true, and that troublemakers will face judgment
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:10 expresses Paul's confidence that believers will not be swayed, and those causing trouble will bear judgment, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness.

questions.question: A believer asks how to practically serve others in love. According to Galatians 5:13, what is the best way to serve one another?
options: By strict obedience to the law
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:13 instructs believers to use their liberty not for selfish gain but to serve one another through love, reflecting the fulfillment of the law as stated in 5:14.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But the fruit of the Spirit is ________, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith;' (Galatians 5:22)
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:22 lists love as the first fruit of the Spirit, emphasizing its importance in Christian life and character.

hard.title: Galatians Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Galatians Chapter 5.

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize as the true source of freedom in Galatians 5:1?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:1 instructs believers to stand fast in the liberty wherewith Christ has made them free, emphasizing freedom through Christ rather than through the law or customs.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:2-3, what obligation does circumcision impose on a person?
questions.explanation: Paul states in Galatians 5:3 that a circumcised person is a debtor to do the whole law, highlighting the burden of legalism imposed by circumcision.

questions.question: What consequence does Paul warn of for those justified by the law in Galatians 5:4?
questions.explanation: In Galatians 5:4, Paul explains that those justified by the law have fallen from grace, meaning they reject the grace of Christ by relying on legalism.

questions.question: In Galatians 5:6, what is said to have true value in Jesus Christ?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:6 asserts that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith working through love is what truly matters in Christ.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in Galatians 5:9 to describe how a small negative influence can affect a community?
options: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump
A tiny mustard seed grows into a large tree
A small spark lights a great fire
A single stone can cause a landslide
questions.correctAnswer: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor of leaven in Galatians 5:9 to warn that a small corrupting influence can affect the entire community.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'ye have been called unto liberty' in Galatians 5:13?
options: Called to live free from the law but serve others in love
Called to live without any moral restrictions
Called to abandon faith and law
Called to observe strict Jewish customs
questions.correctAnswer: Called to live free from the law but serve others in love
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:13 teaches that believers are called to freedom, but this freedom should not be used for selfish desires but to serve one another through love.

questions.question: How does Paul summarize the entire law in Galatians 5:14?
questions.explanation: Paul declares in Galatians 5:14 that all the law is fulfilled in the single command to love one’s neighbor as oneself.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give about interpersonal conflict in Galatians 5:15?
options: Biting and devouring one another leads to mutual destruction
Disputes are signs of spiritual growth
Silence is the best way to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Biting and devouring one another leads to mutual destruction
questions.explanation: In Galatians 5:15, Paul warns that destructive behavior among believers can lead to their mutual ruin.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the flesh and the Spirit as described in Galatians 5:17?
options: They are contrary and oppose each other
The Spirit is subject to the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: They are contrary and oppose each other
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:17 explains that the flesh and the Spirit are opposed, creating a conflict that prevents doing what one desires.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:18, what is the status of those who are led by the Spirit?
options: They are not under the law
They must obey all ceremonial laws
They are condemned by the law
questions.correctAnswer: They are not under the law
questions.explanation: Paul states in Galatians 5:18 that those led by the Spirit are not under the law, indicating a new covenant relationship through the Spirit.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed among the works of the flesh in Galatians 5:19-21?
questions.explanation: Longsuffering is listed as a fruit of the Spirit in Galatians 5:22, not as a work of the flesh in verses 19-21.

questions.question: What assurance does Paul give about those who practice the works of the flesh in Galatians 5:21?
options: They shall not inherit the kingdom of God
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not inherit the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: In Galatians 5:21, Paul warns that those who do such works of the flesh will not inherit God’s kingdom.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in the fruit of the Spirit according to Galatians 5:22-23?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:23 lists meekness as part of the fruit of the Spirit, contrasting with negative traits like wrath and envyings.

questions.question: What does Paul say about those who belong to Christ in Galatians 5:24?
options: They have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
They must follow the law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: They have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:24 teaches that those belonging to Christ have put to death the sinful nature and its desires.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 5:25, if we live by the Spirit, we should also walk by the Spirit.
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:25 clearly states that if we live in the Spirit, we should also walk in the Spirit, emphasizing consistent spiritual conduct.

theological.title: Galatians Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Galatians Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:1, what are believers exhorted to do in the liberty Christ has given?
options: Stand fast and not be entangled with the yoke of bondage
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast and not be entangled with the yoke of bondage
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:1 commands believers to stand fast in the liberty Christ has given and not be burdened again by the yoke of bondage. This reflects the doctrine of Christian freedom in Christ, consistent with Romans 6:14, John 8:36, 2 Corinthians 3:17, and Acts 13:39, which highlight freedom from the law's condemnation through Christ.

questions.question: What consequence does Paul declare for those who seek justification through circumcision, according to Galatians 5:4?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:4 states that those justified by the law, such as through circumcision, become void of Christ's effect and have fallen from grace. This aligns with Romans 11:6, Hebrews 10:29, John 6:44, and Ephesians 2:8-9, emphasizing justification by faith apart from works of the law.

questions.question: In Galatians 5:6, what is said to be the only thing that truly matters in Christ Jesus?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:6 emphasizes that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but only faith working through love. This highlights the primacy of faith empowered by love in salvation, consistent with Romans 5:1, 1 Corinthians 13:2, Galatians 2:16, and James 2:17.

questions.question: What does Paul warn about in Galatians 5:9 using the metaphor of leaven?
options: A little leaven leavens the whole lump
Leaven is a symbol of purity
Leaven should be added to faith
questions.correctAnswer: A little leaven leavens the whole lump
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:9 warns that a small amount of corrupting influence (leaven) can affect the entire community. This metaphor is consistent with Matthew 16:6-12, Exodus 12:15, 1 Corinthians 5:6-7, and Hebrews 12:15, teaching vigilance against false teachings and sin.

questions.question: What is the motivation believers are encouraged to use their liberty for, according to Galatians 5:13?
options: To serve one another in love
questions.correctAnswer: To serve one another in love
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:13 teaches that liberty should not be an occasion for the flesh but should be used to serve one another through love. This principle echoes Jesus' command to love one another (John 13:34), Romans 13:10, 1 Corinthians 13, and James 2:8.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:14, how is the whole law fulfilled?
options: By loving your neighbor as yourself
questions.correctAnswer: By loving your neighbor as yourself
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:14 states that all the law is fulfilled in one word: loving your neighbor as yourself. This reflects Leviticus 19:18 and Jesus' teaching in Matthew 22:37-40, which summarize the law and prophets, consistent also with Romans 13:9 and James 2:8.

questions.question: What does Paul say will happen if believers 'bite and devour one another' in Galatians 5:15?
options: They will be consumed one of another
They will be justified by the law
questions.correctAnswer: They will be consumed one of another
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:15 warns that mutual hostility among believers leads to destruction of the community. This is supported by Proverbs 6:16-19, Romans 13:13, 1 Corinthians 3:3, and James 3:16, which caution against strife and discord.

questions.question: What is the result of walking in the Spirit as stated in Galatians 5:16?
options: You will not fulfill the lust of the flesh
You will fulfill the law perfectly
You will be saved by works
questions.correctAnswer: You will not fulfill the lust of the flesh
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:16 teaches that walking in the Spirit prevents one from fulfilling sinful desires. This aligns with Romans 8:5-9, Ephesians 5:18, Colossians 3:16, and John 14:16-17, emphasizing the Spirit's role in sanctification.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:17, what is the nature of the relationship between the flesh and the Spirit?
options: They are contrary to one another
They are both necessary for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They are contrary to one another
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:17 describes the flesh and Spirit as opposing forces, causing inner conflict. This is consistent with Romans 7:18-25, James 4:4, 1 John 2:16, and Matthew 26:41, depicting the spiritual struggle in believers.

questions.question: What does Galatians 5:18 say about those who are led by the Spirit?
options: They are not under the law
They must obey all ceremonial laws
They are condemned by the law
They rely on works for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They are not under the law
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:18 states that those led by the Spirit are not under the law. This reflects the fulfillment of the law in Christ, consistent with Romans 8:2-4, Hebrews 8:6-13, Jeremiah 31:33, and John 1:17.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a work of the flesh in Galatians 5:19-21?
questions.explanation: Faith is not a work of the flesh; rather, it is a fruit of the Spirit. Galatians 5:19-21 lists sins such as adultery, wrath, and drunkenness as works of the flesh. This distinction is also supported by Ephesians 2:8, Romans 3:28, and Hebrews 11:1.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in the fruit of the Spirit in Galatians 5:22-23?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:22-23 lists gentleness among the fruit of the Spirit, contrasting with sins like envy, sedition, and idolatry which are works of the flesh (v. 20-21). This fruit reflects Christlike character, consistent with John 15:5, Colossians 3:12, Ephesians 4:2, and Proverbs 15:1.

questions.question: What does Galatians 5:24 say those who belong to Christ have done with the flesh?
options: Crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
Kept the flesh pure by works
questions.correctAnswer: Crucified the flesh with its passions and desires
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:24 teaches that believers have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts, indicating a decisive break from sinful nature. This aligns with Romans 6:6, Colossians 3:5, 2 Corinthians 5:17, and John 12:24.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:25, if we live by the Spirit, what should we also do?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:25 exhorts believers who live in the Spirit to also walk in the Spirit, implying a consistent lifestyle of spiritual dependence and obedience. This is supported by Romans 8:4, Ephesians 5:18, Galatians 2:20, and Philippians 3:16.

questions.question: What behavior does Paul warn against in Galatians 5:26?
options: Being desirous of vain glory, provoking, and envying one another
Serving one another humbly in love
questions.correctAnswer: Being desirous of vain glory, provoking, and envying one another
questions.explanation: Galatians 5:26 warns against selfish ambition, provoking, and envy among believers, which disrupt unity and contradict the Spirit’s fruit. This aligns with Proverbs 27:4, James 3:14-16, Romans 12:10, and Philippians 2:3.
